question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code where possible. Create a practical mind mapping mini-program or executable HTML code that will allow me to easily create mind maps.

checklist.title: Is the core mind mapping functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements node creation, deletion, editing, and hierarchical relationships through HTML/JavaScript/SVG. Must include drag-and-drop node positioning, parent-child relationship management, and dynamic branch connections. Score 0 if basic node operations are missing, 5 if only static node display is implemented, and 10 if full interactive mind mapping with real-time connection updates is achieved.

checklist.title: Is the visual node connection system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the connection lines between nodes use proper algorithms (Bezier curves or optimized paths) and dynamically update when nodes are moved. Evaluate if connection points are accurately calculated and visually appealing. Deduct 5 points if connections don't follow nodes during drag operations, 3 points if line overlapping issues exist, and 5 points if connection algorithms cause performance issues. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is comprehensive data persistence and export functionality provided?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the mind map data can be saved locally (localStorage/IndexedDB) and exported in standard formats (JSON/XML/PNG/SVG). Check if import functionality exists for data recovery. Deduct 5 points if only basic localStorage is used without proper data structure, 3 points if export formats are limited, and 5 points if no import/recovery mechanism exists. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is advanced mind mapping interaction design implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes professional mind mapping features such as node styling customization (colors, shapes, fonts), zoom and pan functionality, keyboard shortcuts, and multi-selection operations. Deduct 5 points if zoom/pan is not smooth or missing, 3 points if keyboard shortcuts are not implemented, and 5 points if node customization options are limited. Give 10 points if fully implemented with professional UX patterns.

checklist.title: Is the code robust and handles edge cases properly?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid node operations, data corruption, browser compatibility issues, and memory leaks during extensive mind map creation). Code with strong robustness should effectively handle these edge cases and provide user-friendly error messages. Give 10 points for excellent error handling, 5 points for basic exception handling, and 0 points if no error handling exists.

checklist.title: Are there innovative features that enhance user experience?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes advanced features that distinguish it from basic mind mapping tools (e.g., 1. Auto-layout algorithms for optimal node positioning 2. Template system with predefined mind map structures 3. Real-time collaboration features 4. AI-powered content suggestions 5. Advanced search and filtering). Add 2-3 points for each well-implemented innovative feature (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant or unnecessary features?
checklist.description: Strictly check for three types of redundancy: 1. Duplicate functionality implementations (e.g., multiple save mechanisms that conflict) 2. Features unrelated to mind mapping core purpose (e.g., built-in games or social media integration) 3. Over-engineered animations that impact performance without adding value. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and deduct 10 points if redundant code interferes with core mind mapping functionality.

checklist.title: Does the code demonstrate high engineering quality standards?
checklist.description: Review modular architecture (separation of data model, view rendering, and user interaction layers), code organization, and maintainability. Check for proper event handling, memory management, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points for poor separation of concerns or spaghetti code structure; deduct 5 points if code duplication exceeds 25%; deduct 5 points for inefficient DOM manipulation or rendering bottlenecks. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface design meet professional visual standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the mind mapping interface follows modern design principles: 1) Clean and intuitive toolbar design with proper iconography 2) Consistent color scheme that enhances readability (background contrast ratio â‰¥ 4.5:1) 3) Proper spacing and typography (minimum 12px font size, adequate line spacing). Deduct 3 points for cluttered UI elements, 5 points for poor color contrast or accessibility issues, and 5 points for inconsistent visual hierarchy. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the interactive animations smooth and enhance usability?
checklist.description: Judge whether dynamic effects support productive mind mapping workflow: 1) Node creation/deletion animations are smooth and provide clear feedback 2) Drag operations have appropriate visual cues and snap-to-grid behavior 3) Zoom/pan transitions are fluid without jarring jumps 4) Loading states and transitions don't interrupt user flow. Deduct 5 points for laggy animations during complex operations, 3 points for missing visual feedback on user actions, and 5 points for disorienting or excessive animations. Full score is 10 points.
